subject: Fixes type and description for NeutronL3HA
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-21 20:32:39.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/neutron-server.yaml', 'puppet/services/pacemaker/neutron-server.yaml'], 'message': "Fixes type and description for NeutronL3HA

puppet-neutron takes this variable as boolean.  Although it doesn't
change the behavior in master (because the variable is used directly as
config), in mitaka it is used as a conditional and should be properly
fixed.

Also a fix is needed in python-tripleoclient because it is hard coded to
be True there based on number of controllers being greater than 1.
Therefore we shoudl remove that logic from tripleoclient and implement
it in THT.  In order to do that the pacemaker version of the variable is
defaulted to true.

Partial-Bug: 1605379

Change-Id: I0b797dbe188382e2dc32506913aaa60a0a21bd68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes type and description for NeutronL3HA

puppet-neutron takes this variable as boolean.  Although it doesn't
change the behavior in master (because the variable is used directly as
config), in mitaka it is used as a conditional and should be properly
fixed.

Also a fix is needed in python-tripleoclient because it is hard coded to
be True there based on number of controllers being greater than 1.
Therefore we shoudl remove that logic from tripleoclient and implement
it in THT.  In order to do that the pacemaker version of the variable is
defaulted to true.

Partial-Bug: 1605379

Change-Id: I0b797dbe188382e2dc32506913aaa60a0a21bd68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-09 23:24:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/test_mech_openvswitch.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/mech_driver/mech_openvswitch.py', 'releasenotes/notes/firewall_driver_not_needed_on_server-4159669ad834dea6.yaml', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "OVS Mech: Set hybrid plug based on agent config

This adjusts the logic in the OVS mechanism driver to determine
what the ovs_hybrid_plug value should be set to in the VIF details.
Previously it was based purely on the firewall driver configured on
the server side. This prevented a mixed environment where some agents
might be running a native OVS firewall driver while others are still
based on the IPTables hybrid driver.

This patch has the OVS agents report back whether they want hybrid
plugging in their configuration dictionary sent during report_state.
The OVS agent sets this based on an explicit attribute on the firewall
driver requesting OVS hybrid plugging.

To maintain backward compat, if an agent doesn't report this, the old
logic of basing it off of the server-side config is applied.

DocImpact: The server no longer needs to be configured with a firewall
           driver for OVS. It will read config from agent state reports.
Closes-Bug: #1560957
Change-Id: Ie554c2d37ce036e7b51818048153b466eee02913
(cherry picked from commit 2f17a30ba04082889f3a703aca1884b031767942)
"}]
commit_message:
OVS Mech: Set hybrid plug based on agent config

This adjusts the logic in the OVS mechanism driver to determine
what the ovs_hybrid_plug value should be set to in the VIF details.
Previously it was based purely on the firewall driver configured on
the server side. This prevented a mixed environment where some agents
might be running a native OVS firewall driver while others are still
based on the IPTables hybrid driver.

This patch has the OVS agents report back whether they want hybrid
plugging in their configuration dictionary sent during report_state.
The OVS agent sets this based on an explicit attribute on the firewall
driver requesting OVS hybrid plugging.

To maintain backward compat, if an agent doesn't report this, the old
logic of basing it off of the server-side config is applied.

DocImpact: The server no longer needs to be configured with a firewall
           driver for OVS. It will read config from agent state reports.
Closes-Bug: #1560957
Change-Id: Ie554c2d37ce036e7b51818048153b466eee02913
(cherry picked from commit 2f17a30ba04082889f3a703aca1884b031767942)

commit_message:
Wait for vswitchd to add interfaces in native ovsdb

ovs-vsctl, unless --no-wait is passed, will wait until ovs-vswitchd
has reacted to a successful transaction. This patch implements
the same logic, waiting for next_cfg to be incremented and checking
that any added interfaces have actually been assigned ofports.

Closes-Bug: #1604816
Closes-Bug: #1604370
Related-Bug: #1604115
Change-Id: I638b82c13394f150c0bd23301285bd3375e66139

subject: Fix get_url SNI issues in CentOS 7
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-07-28 16:44:57.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix get_url SNI issues in CentOS 7

CentOS 7 comes with Python 2.7.5, which does not have support for
servers that use Server Name Indication (SNI) to host more than
one SSL certificate on the same IP address. Three Python modules
are required on CentOS 7 systems to add this support:

* pyasn1
* pyOpenSSL
* ndg-httpsclient

This patch should prevent the SSL verification issues that occur
when the RabbitMQ RPMs are downloaded with get_url.

Closes-bug: 1604922

Change-Id: Ia14f25ed0ae399cfea6177adb6d34582a40c9249
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get_url SNI issues in CentOS 7

CentOS 7 comes with Python 2.7.5, which does not have support for
servers that use Server Name Indication (SNI) to host more than
one SSL certificate on the same IP address. Three Python modules
are required on CentOS 7 systems to add this support:

* pyasn1
* pyOpenSSL
* ndg-httpsclient

This patch should prevent the SSL verification issues that occur
when the RabbitMQ RPMs are downloaded with get_url.

Closes-bug: 1604922

Change-Id: Ia14f25ed0ae399cfea6177adb6d34582a40c9249

The service clients for the volume service are different from
the other services and it is a little difficult to read and
debug because that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization,  but actually
the merit seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Change-Id: Ia51e2580af4df088fde71520890cb11c3e27ca86

commit_message:
Remove base_availability_zone_client for the reability

The service clients for the volume service are different from
the other services and it is a little difficult to read and
debug because that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization,  but actually
the merit seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ia51e2580af4df088fde71520890cb11c3e27ca86

commit_message:
Remove base_extensions_client for the reability

The service clients for the volume service are different from
the other services and it is a little difficult to read and
debug because that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization,  but actually
the merit seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ib9a89d94da30592ee22a1d60bf419c4d988471c3

commit_message:
Add ability to specify release name

Rignt now we can't bump release name for OPENSTACK_RELEASE_* vars  so
making it configurable via env vars is less harmful way to unlock
development.

Change-Id: If7bd57693890f76022e15a77ad63243cd993e144
Closes-bug:1607653

subject: Correct perms of /var/run/heat-config/heat-config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-26 22:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/install.d/50-heat-config', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/install.d/heat-config', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/55-heat-config'], 'message': "Correct perms of /var/run/heat-config/heat-config

/var/run isn't persisted during image building, so relying on
os-apply-config preserving the permissions of the existing file won't
work because there isn't one.

Instead, 55-heat-config needs to check and fix the permissions of this
file on each run. Once it is set by 55-heat-config, os-apply-config
will respect the corrected permissions when overwriting.

Change-Id: Iecce01d31d66f217ccf4b34cc29f05465dc1886d
Closes-Bug: #1520347
"}]
commit_message:
Correct perms of /var/run/heat-config/heat-config

/var/run isn't persisted during image building, so relying on
os-apply-config preserving the permissions of the existing file won't
work because there isn't one.

Instead, 55-heat-config needs to check and fix the permissions of this
file on each run. Once it is set by 55-heat-config, os-apply-config
will respect the corrected permissions when overwriting.

Change-Id: Iecce01d31d66f217ccf4b34cc29f05465dc1886d
Closes-Bug: #1520347

commit_message:
Convert service_name to underscore syntax

Currently we use hyphens, e.g cinder-api, but in overcloud.yaml
we have a lot of references to services (e.g for AllNodesConfig)
by underscore, e.g cinder_api.  To enable dynamic generation of
this data, we need the service name in underscore format.

Change-Id: Ief13dfe5d8d7691dfe2534ad5c39d7eacbcb6f70

commit_message:
enable mcollective (restart)

mcollective service is masked on early
stages, so restating it in cc_mcollective.py
actually does nothing. We have to restart it
when service is explicitely unmasked, what
is done in runcmd section.

blueprint: mos-xenial

Change-Id: I6ef54e45b5c06f136fe44d2d0e0932b77f752d13

Currently we are still creating all the pacemaker constraints for nova
in the main overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp manifest file.

Let's move those to each role where they belong. Note that given
that a constraint depends on two separate pacemaker resources it is a

Depends-On: I96a3a313d15fac820b020feae0568437c2cbade3

Change-Id: I4f15485b1f355b3b38fc6c16552f204aa8bba7bc

commit_message:
Move nova constraints from controller manifest to each service

Currently we are still creating all the pacemaker constraints for nova
in the main overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp manifest file.

Let's move those to each role where they belong. Note that given
that a constraint depends on two separate pacemaker resources it is a
bit arbitrary in which file they end up being (the one of the first
resource or the second one).

Depends-On: I96a3a313d15fac820b020feae0568437c2cbade3

Change-Id: I4f15485b1f355b3b38fc6c16552f204aa8bba7bc

commit_message:
Fixed issue with Heat system tests

We had outdated Heat SWARM test which installed
incorrect configuration of OpenStack cluster.
We also need to verify Ceilometer services before
run of Heat platform OSTF tests to make sure Ceilometer
works fine, it will help to debug the issues with
Heat autoscaling in the future.

Change-Id: Iada13db7c74e50ddf0c9cd446b808f91a30e9a1e
Closes-Bug: #1591327

commit_message:
Fixed issue with Heat system tests

We had outdated Heat SWARM test which installed
incorrect configuration of OpenStack cluster.
We also need to verify Ceilometer services before
run of Heat platform OSTF tests to make sure Ceilometer
works fine, it will help to debug the issues with
Heat autoscaling in the future.

Change-Id: Iada13db7c74e50ddf0c9cd446b808f91a30e9a1e
Closes-Bug: #1591327

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-28 15:18:53.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'etc/fuel-agent/fuel-agent.conf.sample', 'fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "Remove extra root= kernel parameter

Xenial-based IBP kernel boot parameters contain 'root=UUID=XXX'
record where 'XXX' points to UID of lvm volume,but in this moment
lvm groups is not activated and root partition cannot be mounted.

This occurs because script, which should activate lvm, does not handle
'UUID' option. Lvm2 Xenial package relying on presence of systemd to
activate its volumes.

In early releases this works by specific udev rules
(/lib/udev/rules.d/85-lvm2.rules)

Change-Id: I8ebe209e4de479a30c70222a35cabcfacbfd2e6c
blueprint: mos-xenial
Closes-Bug: 1552346
"}]
commit_message:
Remove extra root= kernel parameter

Xenial-based IBP kernel boot parameters contain 'root=UUID=XXX'
record where 'XXX' points to UID of lvm volume,but in this moment
lvm groups is not activated and root partition cannot be mounted.

This occurs because script, which should activate lvm, does not handle
'UUID' option. Lvm2 Xenial package relying on presence of systemd to
activate its volumes.

In early releases this works by specific udev rules
(/lib/udev/rules.d/85-lvm2.rules)

Change-Id: I8ebe209e4de479a30c70222a35cabcfacbfd2e6c
blueprint: mos-xenial
Closes-Bug: 1552346

commit_message:
Move nova constraints from controller manifest to each service

Currently we are still creating all the pacemaker constraints for nova
in the main overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp manifest file.

Let's move those to each role where they belong. Note that given
that a constraint depends on two separate pacemaker resources it is
a bit arbitrary in which file they end up being (the one of the first
resource or the second one).

Change-Id: I96a3a313d15fac820b020feae0568437c2cbade3

subject: Use handle_update_cancel() to cancel nested stack updates
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-28 16:30:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py'], 'message': 'Use handle_update_cancel() to cancel nested stack updates

The code designed to deal with the case where an in-progress StackResource
update is cancelled by stopping the update of the nested stack has never
worked because it was erroneously trying to catch StopIteration exceptions
instead of the actual exception raised when a generator is closed,
GeneratorExit.

This change moves the handling code to the new handle_update_cancel()
mechanism instead. Using this mechanism also means that StackResources will
be cancelled immediately, rather than waiting for up to error_wait_time
before cancelling the nested stack update. The previous patch adds a grace
period for IN_PROGRESS resources within the nested stack to complete, so we
want to notify it straight away to begin that period (and to not start any
new work).

Since the grace period on the child stack means that the child is likely to
still be IN_PROGRESS at the time we want to roll back, handle rollback by
sending an update-cancel with rollback message to the child. Only if the
child is no longer IN_PROGRESS will we start an update with the previous
template. If it is still IN_PROGRESS then just wait for it to reach
ROLLBACK_COMPLETE.

Change-Id: Ide210f695446fe8de2057b3b74c276165a6f9f3f
Closes-Bug: #1591337
Closes-Bug: #1446252
'}]
commit_message:
Use handle_update_cancel() to cancel nested stack updates

The code designed to deal with the case where an in-progress StackResource
update is cancelled by stopping the update of the nested stack has never
worked because it was erroneously trying to catch StopIteration exceptions
instead of the actual exception raised when a generator is closed,
GeneratorExit.

This change moves the handling code to the new handle_update_cancel()
mechanism instead. Using this mechanism also means that StackResources will
be cancelled immediately, rather than waiting for up to error_wait_time
before cancelling the nested stack update. The previous patch adds a grace
period for IN_PROGRESS resources within the nested stack to complete, so we
want to notify it straight away to begin that period (and to not start any
new work).

Since the grace period on the child stack means that the child is likely to
still be IN_PROGRESS at the time we want to roll back, handle rollback by
sending an update-cancel with rollback message to the child. Only if the
child is no longer IN_PROGRESS will we start an update with the previous
template. If it is still IN_PROGRESS then just wait for it to reach
ROLLBACK_COMPLETE.

Change-Id: Ide210f695446fe8de2057b3b74c276165a6f9f3f
Closes-Bug: #1591337
Closes-Bug: #1446252

Fix some simple mistake

1.The configure is different to the output in install guide.
2.k8s_api has list_namespaced_pod() rather than list_namespaced_pods().
3.Before division, we should check whether the divisor is zero.

Change-Id: I9ca676eac4e3dcba4dcc5553bb5502896d73960e

subject: etcd: don't run heartbeat() concurrently
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-27 08:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/etcd.py'], 'message': "etcd: don't run heartbeat() concurrently

As the bug specifies, running heartbeat() concurrently to other actions
(such as release()) is raceful as using heartbeat() can and will change
the modifiedIndex field of a lock, thus breaking the compare function of
the Compare-and-Delete used by release(). This patch, therefore, uses
threading's Lock object to make sure only a single action is done
concurrently in tooz' etcd driver.

Closes-Bug: #1603005
Change-Id: Ief32a3d5add90ebbd4adf825d78fca3dd57e5d9e
"}]
commit_message:
etcd: don't run heartbeat() concurrently

As the bug specifies, running heartbeat() concurrently to other actions
(such as release()) is raceful as using heartbeat() can and will change
the modifiedIndex field of a lock, thus breaking the compare function of
the Compare-and-Delete used by release(). This patch, therefore, uses
threading's Lock object to make sure only a single action is done
concurrently in tooz' etcd driver.

Closes-Bug: #1603005
Change-Id: Ief32a3d5add90ebbd4adf825d78fca3dd57e5d9e

commit_message:
Add new project: nova-mksproxy

nova-mksproxy is a standalone Nova console proxy for instances running
on VMware. Nova has support for MKS consoles since microversion 2.8. The
fixes that we made with microversion 2.31 finally allow creation of a
standalone MKS proxy.

Bay name should start with only small or capital letter. Names
can contain small letter([a-z]), capital letter([A-Z]), hypen(-),
digits([0-1]), underscore (_) and periods (.). Names should follow

Closes-Bug: #1605561

commit_message:
Bay name must start with alphabets only

Bay name should start with only small or capital letter. Names
can contain small letter([a-z]), capital letter([A-Z]), hypen(-),
digits([0-1]), underscore (_) and periods (.). Names should follow
^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$ regular expression.

Change-Id: I7581f0a99cee5708601b11c571a774acbeace3bd
Closes-Bug: #1605561

commit_message:
trunk: declare port_id as a primary key

This makes object fields reflect database model. This makes it
impossible to use get_object for a trunk object with just an ID, which
required to switch to get_objects in several places, since this other
method is more forgiving.

Change-Id: I3e9f40d97381cbe52aa35268a74a9d6f4fe0a764
Partially-Implements: bp/adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

subject: use git directly instead of through zuul-cloner
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 20:42:04.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/release_from_yaml.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/release-tools/functions', 'jenkins/scripts/release-tools/release.sh'], 'message': "use git directly instead of through zuul-cloner

The node that runs tag-releases does not have zuul-cloner
installed. Since there's no local git cache anyway, just use git
commands directly for the release-related jobs. If we add a git cache
and find a secure way to install zuul-cloner we can go back to using it.

Change-Id: Iadbb8521bcf7001aabb986d6f2320931221e1039
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
use git directly instead of through zuul-cloner

The node that runs tag-releases does not have zuul-cloner
installed. Since there's no local git cache anyway, just use git
commands directly for the release-related jobs. If we add a git cache
and find a secure way to install zuul-cloner we can go back to using it.

Change-Id: Iadbb8521bcf7001aabb986d6f2320931221e1039
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 22:14:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/nodepool.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add diskimage-builder nodepool test

Add a add a "nodepool with diskimage-builder from source" job as
experiemental (and non-voting) for dib.

The idea is to test that new diskimage-builder changes still work with
nodepool to make a bootable image.

(ps. changeset 1 made the shade-src template less specific, but
PROJECTS is different; shade in openstack-infra/shade, dib in
openstack/diskimage-builder.  So the template started looking odd with
too many arguments).

Change-Id: I28356d346117cd571c35a1374aab7bc9031db8c3
Depends-On: I480dcb201aa93bc3d208e2bf5e96bcee6dd7df09

commit_message:
Add diskimage-builder nodepool test

Add a add a "nodepool with diskimage-builder from source" job as
experiemental (and non-voting) for dib.

The idea is to test that new diskimage-builder changes still work with
nodepool to make a bootable image.

(ps. changeset 1 made the shade-src template less specific, but
PROJECTS is different; shade in openstack-infra/shade, dib in
openstack/diskimage-builder.  So the template started looking odd with
too many arguments).

Change-Id: I28356d346117cd571c35a1374aab7bc9031db8c3
Depends-On: I480dcb201aa93bc3d208e2bf5e96bcee6dd7df09

subject: Silence swiftclient logging
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 03:09:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/swift.py'], 'message': "Silence swiftclient logging

swiftclient doesn't use oslo_log and logs ERROR with TRACE for
response exceptions like 404. This isn't desirable for heat which
relies on 404s to know a delete is complete.

This change sets the swiftclient logging level to CRITICAL in the
client plugin.

Change-Id: Ie11a6d19068169424ee883ce428aad306d647f0d
Partial-Bug: #1606404
"}]
commit_message:
Silence swiftclient logging

swiftclient doesn't use oslo_log and logs ERROR with TRACE for
response exceptions like 404. This isn't desirable for heat which
relies on 404s to know a delete is complete.

This change sets the swiftclient logging level to CRITICAL in the
client plugin.

Change-Id: Ie11a6d19068169424ee883ce428aad306d647f0d
Partial-Bug: #1606404

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-28 03:38:01.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/unit/v2/test_cli_action_execs.py', 'mistralclient/commands/v2/action_executions.py', 'mistralclient/tests/functional/cli/v2/cli_tests_v2.py'], 'message': 'Different formatters for "action-execution-get" and "action-execution-list"

* In list representation it doesn't make a lot of sense to show
  state info (even in shrinked form) because one will be looking at
  it most likely if state is not SUCCESS, individually for every
  action execution object. Removing this field though allows to
  represent this table in a more consistent form.

Change-Id: Iee5aabf386b79fdc8aaca7528d22a4675dd303a4
'}]
commit_message:
Different formatters for "action-execution-get" and "action-execution-list"

* In list representation it doesn't make a lot of sense to show
  state info (even in shrinked form) because one will be looking at
  it most likely if state is not SUCCESS, individually for every
  action execution object. Removing this field though allows to
  represent this table in a more consistent form.

Change-Id: Iee5aabf386b79fdc8aaca7528d22a4675dd303a4

commit_message:
Fix user & database pagination in guests

Make sure we serialized paginated objects and not the other way round.
Ensure the 'next marker' is a string (name).
Encapsulate the logic in a utility function and add tests.

Update only guests that have been using the pagination functions.

Tested with scenario tests on Cassandra and Postgresql.

Change-Id: I0898270f1afcbe95a431492b1195fb3dd33e9d88
Closes-Bug: 1592099

commit_message:
Providing kernel_args if available in instance_info for boot options

The boot parameters are stored in the instance_info as
kernel_args, which has to be given to IPA install_bootloader
command for localboot and to be updated on pxe conf for netboot

Closes-Bug: #1592329

Change-Id: Ib44a465a4d8383489e187e45198f99635ea4acce

subject: Fix of ping usage in net_helpers.async_ping()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7715, 'name': 'Hirofumi Ichihara', 'email': 'ichihara.hirofumi@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hirofumi-Ichihara'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19797, 'name': 'Hynek Mlnarik', 'email': 'hmlnarik@redhat.com', 'username': 'hmlnarik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 22:38:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/common/net_helpers.py'], 'message': 'Fix of ping usage in net_helpers.async_ping()

net_helpers.async_ping() should pass when each of the ICMP echo requests
is matched by a corresponding ICMP echo reply, and it should fail if a
response is not received for some request. The async_ping implementation
relies on the ping exit code: when ping returns nonzero exit code,
RuntimeException would be consequentially thrown and async_ping assertion
would thus fail.

Current implementation of net_helpers.async_ping() is broken due to its
usage of -c parameter of ping command and assumption that if _some_ of
the ICMP replies does not arrive, ping would return nonzero exit code.
However, Linux ping works in the way that if _at least one_ reply is
received from any number of ICMP ping requests, result code is 0
(success) and thus no RuntimeException is thrown. This commit fixes
assert_ping to be a reliable assertion guaranteeing that no ping request
stays without reply. For simple bash reproducer and more thorough
discussion of possible solutions, see the bug description.

Closes-Bug: #1588731
Change-Id: I9257b94a8ebbfaf1c4266c1f8ce3097657bacee5
(cherry picked from commit 2dcacaae88970365350200ca58982a18e21c703d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix of ping usage in net_helpers.async_ping()

net_helpers.async_ping() should pass when each of the ICMP echo requests
is matched by a corresponding ICMP echo reply, and it should fail if a
response is not received for some request. The async_ping implementation
relies on the ping exit code: when ping returns nonzero exit code,
RuntimeException would be consequentially thrown and async_ping assertion
would thus fail.

Current implementation of net_helpers.async_ping() is broken due to its
usage of -c parameter of ping command and assumption that if _some_ of
the ICMP replies does not arrive, ping would return nonzero exit code.
However, Linux ping works in the way that if _at least one_ reply is
received from any number of ICMP ping requests, result code is 0
(success) and thus no RuntimeException is thrown. This commit fixes
assert_ping to be a reliable assertion guaranteeing that no ping request
stays without reply. For simple bash reproducer and more thorough
discussion of possible solutions, see the bug description.

Closes-Bug: #1588731
Change-Id: I9257b94a8ebbfaf1c4266c1f8ce3097657bacee5
(cherry picked from commit 2dcacaae88970365350200ca58982a18e21c703d)

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are
being renamed to ``project_id``.

This networking-sfc change accompanies the neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

subject: Generalize logic for skipping final image generation
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-28 18:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'elements/no-final-image/README.rst', 'elements/ironic-agent/element-deps'], 'message': "Generalize logic for skipping final image generation

Since the ironic-agent element builds the ramdisk and extracts the
kernel itself, there's no need to actually generate an image at the
end of the process.  Previously the unnecessary image was being
deleted, but this wastes a bunch of time compressing and converting
the image.  It's better to just not create the image at all.

This change adds a noop element called no-final-image that
disk-image-create looks for in the element list and, if found, will
cause it to skip the final image generation.  This is more flexible
than the previous ironic-agent-specific method that would have
required changes to disk-image-create for every element that wanted
to behave similarly.

Note that this cannot be done using an environment variable, because
element environments.d entries do not propagate out to
disk-image-create.  It also doesn't make sense as a user option
because it should be set by the element author, not the user.

Change-Id: I168feb18f0d578b3babbe4784d3ef75e755e1ebd
"}]
commit_message:
Generalize logic for skipping final image generation

Since the ironic-agent element builds the ramdisk and extracts the
kernel itself, there's no need to actually generate an image at the
end of the process.  Previously the unnecessary image was being
deleted, but this wastes a bunch of time compressing and converting
the image.  It's better to just not create the image at all.

This change adds a noop element called no-final-image that
disk-image-create looks for in the element list and, if found, will
cause it to skip the final image generation.  This is more flexible
than the previous ironic-agent-specific method that would have
required changes to disk-image-create for every element that wanted
to behave similarly.

Note that this cannot be done using an environment variable, because
element environments.d entries do not propagate out to
disk-image-create.  It also doesn't make sense as a user option
because it should be set by the element author, not the user.

Change-Id: I168feb18f0d578b3babbe4784d3ef75e755e1ebd

commit_message:
[WIP]Intoduce 'Murano Application Guide' in User Guide

Application catalog aka Murano is one of place, where user can pick
some cloud-ready application and spin it a OpenStack cloud. So it is
reasonable to provide to user an information about this opportunity.

Change-Id: I60d0a6fbd7f52f14122794e90e43adfc48fa3f59

commit_message:
Add Libreswan installation guide in devstack.rst

Libreswan device driver had already supported from
Liberty, so we can install VPNaaS in CentOS7 or RHEL7.
Default DevStack setting for IPSEC package is openswan.

This patch give some example for the manually IPsec
package installation in devstack docs.

Change-Id: I156ba72baeb8c540bdf0ed23669ed2255f270184

commit_message:
Check compatibility when auto schedule ha routers

When l3 agents do fullsync, the server configured router_auto_schedule
will schedule ha routers whose l3 agent count don't reach
max_l3_agents_per_router to the agent. Need to check compatibility
before binding.

Change-Id: Ie9869eae2bd01c19da5820b4e7ecb7cba7b5692a
Closes-Bug: 1598422
(cherry picked from commit 9f30df85fe78d830331a43fa29fc2d83708c861d)

subject: Always call ipam driver on subnet update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12912, 'name': 'John Belamaric', 'email': 'jbelamaric@infoblox.com', 'username': 'johnbelamaric'}, {'_account_id': 13768, 'name': 'Pavel Bondar', 'email': 'pbondar@infoblox.com', 'username': 'pavel_bondar'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 15:36:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/test_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/ipam/drivers/neutrondb_ipam/driver.py'], 'message': "Always call ipam driver on subnet update

Backport contains two commits:
- 6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51 had some negative impact on
  concurrency;
- 310074b2d457a6de2fdf141d4ede6b6044efc002 fixes that negative impact;

COMMIT 1:
Previously ipam driver was not called on subnet update
if allocation_pools are not in request.
Changing it to call ipam driver each time subnet update is requested.
If subnet_update is called without allocation_pools, then old allocation
pools are passed to ipam driver.

Contains a bit of refactoring to make that happen:

- validate_allocation_pools is already called during update
subnet workflow in update_subnet method, so just removing it;

- reworked update_db_subnet workflow;

previous workflow was:
call driver allocation -> make local allocation -> rollback driver
allocation in except block if local allocation failed.

new workflow:
make local allocation -> call driver allocation.
By changing order of execution we eliminating need of rollback in this
method, since failure in local allocation is rolled back by database
transaction rollback.

- make a copy of incoming subnet dict;
_update_subnet_allocation_pools from ipam_backend_mixin removes
'allocation_pools' from subnet_dict, so create an unchanged copy to
pass it to ipam driver

COMMIT 2:
Check if pool update is needed in reference driver

Commit 6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51 had some negative impact
on concurrent ip allocations. To make ipam driver aware of subnet
updates (mostly for thirdparty drivers) ipam driver is always called
with allocation pools even if pools are not changed.

Current way of handling that event is deleting old pools and creating
new pools. But on scale it may cause issues, because of this:
- deleting allocation pools removes availability ranges by foreign key;
- any ip allocation modifies availability range;
These events concurently modify availability range records causing
deadlocks.

This fix prevents deleting and recreating pools and availability ranges
in cases where allocation pools are not changed. So it eliminates
negative impact on concurency added by always calling ipam driver on
subnet update.
This fix aims to provide backportable solution to be used with
6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51.

Complete solution that eliminates concurrent modifications in
availability range table is expected to be devivered with
ticket #1543094, but it will not be backportable because of the scope of
the change.

Manually resolved conflicts.

Change-Id: Ie4bd85d2ff2ab39bf803c5ef6c6ead151dbb74d7
Closes-Bug: #1534625
Closes-Bug: #1572474
(cherry picked from commit 6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51)
(cherry picked from commit 7a586844ca4454c72876ec3084e4477ce521ece7)
"}]
commit_message:
Always call ipam driver on subnet update

Backport contains two commits:
- 6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51 had some negative impact on
  concurrency;
- 310074b2d457a6de2fdf141d4ede6b6044efc002 fixes that negative impact;

COMMIT 1:
Previously ipam driver was not called on subnet update
if allocation_pools are not in request.
Changing it to call ipam driver each time subnet update is requested.
If subnet_update is called without allocation_pools, then old allocation
pools are passed to ipam driver.

Contains a bit of refactoring to make that happen:

- validate_allocation_pools is already called during update
subnet workflow in update_subnet method, so just removing it;

- reworked update_db_subnet workflow;

previous workflow was:
call driver allocation -> make local allocation -> rollback driver
allocation in except block if local allocation failed.

new workflow:
make local allocation -> call driver allocation.
By changing order of execution we eliminating need of rollback in this
method, since failure in local allocation is rolled back by database
transaction rollback.

- make a copy of incoming subnet dict;
_update_subnet_allocation_pools from ipam_backend_mixin removes
'allocation_pools' from subnet_dict, so create an unchanged copy to
pass it to ipam driver

COMMIT 2:
Check if pool update is needed in reference driver

Commit 6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51 had some negative impact
on concurrent ip allocations. To make ipam driver aware of subnet
updates (mostly for thirdparty drivers) ipam driver is always called
with allocation pools even if pools are not changed.

Current way of handling that event is deleting old pools and creating
new pools. But on scale it may cause issues, because of this:
- deleting allocation pools removes availability ranges by foreign key;
- any ip allocation modifies availability range;
These events concurently modify availability range records causing
deadlocks.

This fix prevents deleting and recreating pools and availability ranges
in cases where allocation pools are not changed. So it eliminates
negative impact on concurency added by always calling ipam driver on
subnet update.
This fix aims to provide backportable solution to be used with
6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51.

Complete solution that eliminates concurrent modifications in
availability range table is expected to be devivered with
ticket #1543094, but it will not be backportable because of the scope of
the change.

Manually resolved conflicts.

Change-Id: Ie4bd85d2ff2ab39bf803c5ef6c6ead151dbb74d7
Closes-Bug: #1534625
Closes-Bug: #1572474
(cherry picked from commit 6ed8f45fdf529bacae32b074844aa1320b005b51)
(cherry picked from commit 7a586844ca4454c72876ec3084e4477ce521ece7)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Update ml2 delete_subnet to deallocate via ipam

Previosly during delete_subnet in ml2 plugin ip allocation were removed
directly from database. This way ipam driver was unaware of this
deallocation.

Updated workflow to skip removing ip allocations directly from database.
Now ips are deallocated during update_port workflow (L1008).

This resolves issue with dhcp ports left in allocated state on ipam
provides side. Now they are correctly deallocated via update_port.

But this patch has next limitation: currently SLAAC allocations can
not be delete via update_port workflow, so ipam driver is still unaware
of such deallocations.
This part of issue is expected to be fixed as separate patch.

auto-allocated ip are already deleted by the time of this check, but
with new workflow auto allocated ips are deleted later (on update_port).
So now this check verifies if there are any user allocated ips instead
of checking all allocations.

(cherry picked from commit 3a2e41bf703d6721fcfe4d72f9ad5c0565fef42d)
(cherry picked from commit 71686cdaedab8ea176a98fd760afd3c9af3f6d9d)
'}]
commit_message:
Update ml2 delete_subnet to deallocate via ipam

Previosly during delete_subnet in ml2 plugin ip allocation were removed
directly from database. This way ipam driver was unaware of this
deallocation.

Updated workflow to skip removing ip allocations directly from database.
Now ips are deallocated during update_port workflow (L1008).

This resolves issue with dhcp ports left in allocated state on ipam
provides side. Now they are correctly deallocated via update_port.

But this patch has next limitation: currently SLAAC allocations can
not be delete via update_port workflow, so ipam driver is still unaware
of such deallocations.
This part of issue is expected to be fixed as separate patch.

Subnet_in_use check was reworked. Previously it assumed that
auto-allocated ip are already deleted by the time of this check, but
with new workflow auto allocated ips are deleted later (on update_port).
So now this check verifies if there are any user allocated ips instead
of checking all allocations.

Partial-Bug: #1564335
Change-Id: I08d66da8cb57ed88e11ec2b18c8345edfce37d37
(cherry picked from commit 3a2e41bf703d6721fcfe4d72f9ad5c0565fef42d)
(cherry picked from commit 71686cdaedab8ea176a98fd760afd3c9af3f6d9d)

commit_message:
TOTP auth not functional in python3

Fixing a byte>str conversion bug present in the TOTP
passcode generation function that was only present in python3
which rendered TOTP auth non-functional in python3.

Also adding a test to check passcode generation returns the
correct format.

Closes-Bug: #1607119

Change-Id: Ie052d559c4eb2577d35caa9f6e240664cf4cf399

commit_message:
Increase default sighup_timeout

It seems at times it takes more time than the current default
for the child processes to exit normally. Increasing it to
120 seconds.

Change-Id: Ic54d2d7edc97cbe07ed4a4445cb865bd1b157f9d
Closes-Bug: #1607177

commit_message:
Pass through original attributes on ShimRequest

The attributes on the original request are required by the
API for checking things like arguments. So this patch adjusts
the ShimRequest class to take the original request so it can
pass through getattr calls to it.

This adds a test that queries for the default security group,
which depends on parsing the get attributes on the security
group shim request.

revisions:

commit_message:
Added signals to results output

Currently, no signals are printed with the output, so now, the slugs of signals
associated with each issue are now printed in the results output. We may
revisit this to add strengths and tags should they be needed in the future.

Change-Id: Ib58127a9d6bb296b9731668e957c15e5c2ef71f4

Increase the number of IP addresses available in the allocation pool
so that environments with more than two network nodes do not run out
of available IP addresses required for DHCP ports.

Change-Id: I014590f9b6621c11f14b6b8c9c30922b9ac23a54
Resolves-Bug: 1596431

commit_message:
Increase size of subnet allocation pool

Increase the number of IP addresses available in the allocation pool
so that environments with more than two network nodes do not run out
of available IP addresses required for DHCP ports.

Change-Id: I014590f9b6621c11f14b6b8c9c30922b9ac23a54
Resolves-Bug: 1596431

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-24 16:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/orchestration/stacks/templates/neutron_basic.yaml'], 'message': "Heat: wait condition: allow insecure HTTPS url

If  `heat_wait_condition_server_url` config in heat.conf starts
with HTTPS but doesn't have a valid HTTPS certificate, the Tempest
test will fail because curl will complain. This patch makes curl
happy by allowing self-signed certificate and the like.

Change-Id: I64d8f88c229de58572532fd6f0e60082b8a8af9f
Closes-Bug: #1512694
"}]
commit_message:
Heat: wait condition: allow insecure HTTPS url

If  `heat_wait_condition_server_url` config in heat.conf starts
with HTTPS but doesn't have a valid HTTPS certificate, the Tempest
test will fail because curl will complain. This patch makes curl
happy by allowing self-signed certificate and the like.

Change-Id: I64d8f88c229de58572532fd6f0e60082b8a8af9f
Closes-Bug: #1512694

Adds the ability to update aggregate metadata where the aggregate is
contained in the API db. Modifications will be made to the 'aggregate_metadata'
table in the API db if that is where the aggregate is located or the cell
database otherwise.

blueprint cells-aggregate-api-db

Change-Id: I456beb753298f4aabbed6d20bea7cbc537842e50
"}]
commit_message:
Make Aggregate metadata functions work with API db

Adds the ability to update aggregate metadata where the aggregate is
contained in the API db. Modifications will be made to the 'aggregate_metadata'
table in the API db if that is where the aggregate is located or the cell
database otherwise.

blueprint cells-aggregate-api-db

Change-Id: I456beb753298f4aabbed6d20bea7cbc537842e50

subject: Do not use $ in OS user password
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 13:19:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/utils/data_utils.py'], 'message': "Do not use $ in OS user password

rand_password shouldn't generate passwords with $
$ is a reserved symbol in Bash
export OS_PASSWORD=<password with $> doesn't work

Change-Id: Iebb211165c4deee09d34e19b5557a3e086add05a
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use $ in OS user password

rand_password shouldn't generate passwords with $
$ is a reserved symbol in Bash
export OS_PASSWORD=<password with $> doesn't work

Change-Id: Iebb211165c4deee09d34e19b5557a3e086add05a

subject: dump() function added to DSL
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-07-28 15:51:49.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_dump.py', 'murano/dsl/serializer.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_functions.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/TestDump.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/manifest.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/metadata/engine/Serialize.yaml'], 'message': "dump() function added to DSL

Added a dsl-level yaql function 'dump' capable to serialize any given
MuranoPL object into one of three different formats identified by its
`serialization_type` argument:

* `Serializable` - a json-compliant notation with '?'-sections
                   describing type metadata including type name,
                   package and package name.
* 'Inline'       - a MuranoPL-compliant notation with dict keys being
                   instances of `MuranoType` class.
* `Mixed`        - similar to `Serializable` but type information is
                   not stringified and is present in '?'-sections as
                   objects of MuranoType class.

Function arguments also control whether object upcasting should be
honored or ignored.

Change-Id: Id36bb5daf9ebbdc42b09ad7bb956f51cfbf3c465
"}]
commit_message:
dump() function added to DSL

Added a dsl-level yaql function 'dump' capable to serialize any given
MuranoPL object into one of three different formats identified by its
`serialization_type` argument:

* `Serializable` - a json-compliant notation with '?'-sections
                   describing type metadata including type name,
                   package and package name.
* 'Inline'       - a MuranoPL-compliant notation with dict keys being
                   instances of `MuranoType` class.
* `Mixed`        - similar to `Serializable` but type information is
                   not stringified and is present in '?'-sections as
                   objects of MuranoType class.

Function arguments also control whether object upcasting should be
honored or ignored.

Change-Id: Id36bb5daf9ebbdc42b09ad7bb956f51cfbf3c465

commit_message:
Adds rate-limiting section to API endpoint section

Based on various OSSN's (such as 0068), this change adds a section
that recommends use of rate-limiting proxies or web application
firewalls, to protect OpenStack endpoints from denial of service
attacks

Change-Id: I0baca7b92cb9fb407a319deed3b6e602f09780db
Closes-Bug: 1607323

subject: Fix get_url SNI issues in CentOS 7
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-27 11:07:13.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Fix get_url SNI issues in CentOS 7

CentOS 7 comes with Python 2.7.5, which does not have support for
servers that use Server Name Indication (SNI) to host more than
one SSL certificate on the same IP address. Three Python modules
are required on CentOS 7 systems to add this support:

* pyasn1
* pyOpenSSL
* ndg-httpsclient

Change-Id: Ie2a6b8d1c6efd9b6d391e0585f95d888470136ff
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get_url SNI issues in CentOS 7

CentOS 7 comes with Python 2.7.5, which does not have support for
servers that use Server Name Indication (SNI) to host more than
one SSL certificate on the same IP address. Three Python modules
are required on CentOS 7 systems to add this support:

* pyasn1
* pyOpenSSL
* ndg-httpsclient

Change-Id: Ie2a6b8d1c6efd9b6d391e0585f95d888470136ff

commit_message:
Update manage with cluster related commands

This patch adds commands to manage.py program to list, remove, and
rename clusters.

It also updates the service list command to display the cluster_name
field.

DocImpact: Updated manage command
Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I7dc4538cc2e1f24c2bf846c115c09bd82da347c9

commit_message:
Fixes compute API unit tests for python3

- Use response.text (string) rather than response.body (bytes)
- Look directly at the Content-Type header, avoiding
  response.content_type property which assumes string header values.

Change-Id: I8fe1a6d454a0c45ba7ef58b9fa1367639650a297
Partially Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton

commit_message:
Keep old behavior of setuptools for editable installs

In the 25.0.0 release [1] of setuptools during any install
operation the package in not overwritten. If a package is
installed from another requirement via pip and then it is
installed again from git, it is not updated causing
check_libs_from_git to fail.

[1] https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/history.html#v25-0-0

Change-Id: Ibaa1d4157816ea649f4452756fbde25951347001
Closes-Bug: #1605998
(cherry picked from commit 88ccd47c88dc39b8d746afae89dea31d46558a68)

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib tenants_client

Tempest 12.1.0 has been released for new library interfaces.
These interfaces are stable[1] and we need to switch using them
instead of current using unstable interfaces.
This will be helpful to avoid breaking gate jobs.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/library.rst#stability

Change-Id: I533abbd7262c1e56bce138f5cfbf4f034e5b75bd
Depends-On: I74a5d5ed43f758b88a22ded293d85d046005d41f

commit_message:
Allow additionalProperties for v2.20 test

On v2.20 of Nova API, a new parameter has been added but we didn't implement
the microversion test on Tempest and the test fails when specifying the
microversion.
This patch makes additionalProperties True as the workaround.

Change-Id: I6b4a05b08b62d775865e0d659c0b67de3600449f
Closes-Bug: #1600186

Implements the HA task to make API route PE requests to same-node PE

Also combined with changes for fast failure on requesting
non-existent service, because many changes shared.

Basic idea is to first ping the service with a short timeout, then
on success, send actual request with longer timeout.

New DSE config parameters:
dse_ping_timeout: timeout for pinging a service
dse_long_timeout: timeout for potentially long requests such as row
    query on PE and action exec on DSD

Closes-Bug: 1600171

Partially implements blueprint: high-availability-design

Change-Id: Ia31f70df89c8a92d441e2c197b23dc8cabc4e464
'}]
commit_message:
API routing to intranode PE

Implements the HA task to make API route PE requests to same-node PE

Also combined with changes for fast failure on requesting
non-existent service, because many changes shared.

Basic idea is to first ping the service with a short timeout, then
on success, send actual request with longer timeout.

New DSE config parameters:
dse_ping_timeout: timeout for pinging a service
dse_long_timeout: timeout for potentially long requests such as row
    query on PE and action exec on DSD

Closes-Bug: 1600171
Closes-Bug: 1600011
Closes-Bug: 1599991
Partially implements blueprint: high-availability-design

Change-Id: Ia31f70df89c8a92d441e2c197b23dc8cabc4e464

commit_message:
Use memcache for keystone_authtoken

This change updates where we calculate the memcache server information
to the globals hiera data and updates all the openstack services to
use the heira memcached_servers key for consistency. Additionally all
api services have been updated to configure the memcached servers for
the keystone_authtoken middleware configuration to improve the
responsiveness of the service.

Change-Id: Id1034e22d79c3ea6b25575d9bcf8e8750a02365d
Closes-Bug: #1597512

subject: Concurrent Execution Control
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-07-28 16:27:16.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/metadata/engine/Synchronize.yaml', 'murano/dsl/executor.py', 'meta/io.murano/manifest.yaml', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/ConcurrencyTest.yaml', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_concurrency.py'], 'message': "Concurrent Execution Control

Added a meta-attrbute class `io.murano.metadata.Synchronize` which may
be attached to any Murano methods to control which objects should
Murano Executor use as synchronization primitives for concurrent
exeutions of the marked methods.
No two methods cannot be called concurrently if their use the same
synhronization objects.
By default (if no attribute is present) the old behavior is preserved:
method calls are synchronized on the objects they are called for.

The attribute has two properties:

* `onThis` (defaults to true) indicates that the method calls should
  be synchronized on target object.
* `onArgs` (defaults to an empty list) indicated that the method calls
  should be synchronized on the values of arguments with the specified
  names.

Truly 'thread-safe' methods may be declared by providing this
attribute with `onThis` set to 'false' and `onArgs` set to default
empty list value.

Executor is modified to properly use this attribute.

Targets-blueprint: application-development-framework

Change-Id: Iea028df1105c57a31a22887916c2428929b83e59
"}]
commit_message:
Concurrent Execution Control

Added a meta-attrbute class `io.murano.metadata.Synchronize` which may
be attached to any Murano methods to control which objects should
Murano Executor use as synchronization primitives for concurrent
exeutions of the marked methods.
No two methods cannot be called concurrently if their use the same
synhronization objects.
By default (if no attribute is present) the old behavior is preserved:
method calls are synchronized on the objects they are called for.

The attribute has two properties:

* `onThis` (defaults to true) indicates that the method calls should
  be synchronized on target object.
* `onArgs` (defaults to an empty list) indicated that the method calls
  should be synchronized on the values of arguments with the specified
  names.

Truly 'thread-safe' methods may be declared by providing this
attribute with `onThis` set to 'false' and `onArgs` set to default
empty list value.

Executor is modified to properly use this attribute.

Targets-blueprint: application-development-framework

Change-Id: Iea028df1105c57a31a22887916c2428929b83e59

InstanceGroup and InstanceProvider hierarchy

Added 'InstanceGroup' - an Instance-based implementation of
'ReplicationGroup' class, and a 'LmiProvider' - a factory class capable
of producing objects of LinuxMuranoInstance class for the
InstanceGroup by cloning a given 'source' instance.

[{'number': 30, 'created': '2016-07-28 15:51:49.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/reflection.py', 'meta/io.murano.applications/Classes/events.yaml', 'meta/io.murano.applications/Classes/tests/TestEvents.yaml', 'meta/io.murano.applications/manifest.yaml', 'doc/source/draft/appdev-guide/murano_pl/class_templ.rst', 'doc/source/draft/appdev-guide/murano_pl/reflection.rst'], 'message': "Event Notification pattern implemented

This patch adds an 'Event' class which may be used to issue various
notifications to other MuranoPl classes in an Event-driven manner.

Any object which is going to emit the notifications should declare the
instances of this new class as its public Runtime properties. The
objects going to subscribe for the notifications should pass
themselves into the 'subscribe' method of the Event along with the
names of their methods which will be used to handle the notification.

The specified handler methods must be present in the subscriber class
(if the method name is missing it will be defaulted to the
'handle%Eventname%') and has at least one standard (i.e. non-vararg
or kwarg) argument.

The class going to emit the notification should call the 'notify'
method of the event and pass itself as the first argument. All the
optional parameters of the event may be passed as varargs/kwargs of
the 'notify' call and will be passed all the way to the handler
methods.

Since this approach relies on the reflection this patch also fixes a
bug #1596647 since its fix is required for the argument reflection to
work properly. It also documents new reflection capabilities which
were added as part of the bugfix.

Closes-Bug: #1596647
Change-Id: Ifa7053e4c7b8456030e8df743f57ed812104b064
"}]
commit_message:
Event Notification pattern implemented

This patch adds an 'Event' class which may be used to issue various
notifications to other MuranoPl classes in an Event-driven manner.

Any object which is going to emit the notifications should declare the
instances of this new class as its public Runtime properties. The
objects going to subscribe for the notifications should pass
themselves into the 'subscribe' method of the Event along with the
names of their methods which will be used to handle the notification.

The specified handler methods must be present in the subscriber class
(if the method name is missing it will be defaulted to the
'handle%Eventname%') and has at least one standard (i.e. non-vararg
or kwarg) argument.

The class going to emit the notification should call the 'notify'
method of the event and pass itself as the first argument. All the
optional parameters of the event may be passed as varargs/kwargs of
the 'notify' call and will be passed all the way to the handler
methods.

Since this approach relies on the reflection this patch also fixes a
bug #1596647 since its fix is required for the argument reflection to
work properly. It also documents new reflection capabilities which
were added as part of the bugfix.

Targets-blueprint: application-development-framework
Closes-Bug: #1596647
Change-Id: Ifa7053e4c7b8456030e8df743f57ed812104b064

commit_message:
Replication classes of Application Development Framework library

This is a first commit for a library package for Application
Development Library (earlier known as "Scalable Framework") called
io.murano.applications

This patch includes the base classes for node Replication
(ReplicaProvider and ReplicationGroup) and their Test-Runner-based
tests, as well as two reference implementations of ReplicaProvider -
one based on the templating (TemplateReplicaProvider) and another one
based on the cloning of passed objects (CloneReplicaProvider).

Both reference provider implementations are covered with their own
tests.

Targets-blueprint: application-development-framework
Change-Id: Ia6a48d51f41693fbb85d2b6c2851c1c286c6aa23

commit_message:
Retry delete snapshot if snapshot is busy

Delete snapshot request shows status as snapshot busy even when
volume created using same snapshot is in deleting state. Possible
fix is to retry delete snapshot request (3 times) which will allow
snapshot-volume delete task to be completed.

Added an unit test to check retry count

Change-Id: I872870fce1fabdb5fb4b4f2b441d6feae6363f99
Closes-Bug: #1600104

subject: Catch all exceptions to move stack to DELETE_FAILED
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-11 09:53:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_delete.py'], 'message': 'Catch all exceptions to move stack to DELETE_FAILED

If an exception occurs after a stack has been put into
CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.

This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to
move the stack to DELETE_FAILED with the reason.

Change-Id: I58f9e2ce1eac1f676b2f3a8f3df7ac0bef430bcc
Closes-Bug: #1492433
'}]
commit_message:
Catch all exceptions to move stack to DELETE_FAILED

If an exception occurs after a stack has been put into
CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.

This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to
move the stack to DELETE_FAILED with the reason.

Change-Id: I58f9e2ce1eac1f676b2f3a8f3df7ac0bef430bcc
Closes-Bug: #1492433

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-04 14:44:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/pci_device.py', 'nova/pci/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_stats.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_manager.py', 'nova/pci/stats.py'], 'message': 'Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.pci.test_manager and test_stats

nova/objects/pci_device.py:
The keys in no_changes were not popped out of the dictionary since map is
lazily evaluated in python3. Changed the map/lambda to simple loop.

nova/pci/manager.py:
In python3 keys() returns an iterator instead of a list (copy of the keys).
This was causing error "RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during
iteration".

nova/pci/stats.py:
Python3 doesn't support cmp anymore.  Use '==' operator instead.

nova/tests/unit/pci/test_manager.py:
keys() now returns dict_keys.  Convert it to a list so that we can compare it
with [].

nova/tests/unit/pci/test_stats.py:
Map are lazily evaluated, convert to basic loop.

Partially Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton

Change-Id: I0b14f169118d87505a736daf46be7ed0af57279b
'}]
commit_message:
Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.pci.test_manager and test_stats

nova/objects/pci_device.py:
The keys in no_changes were not popped out of the dictionary since map is
lazily evaluated in python3. Changed the map/lambda to simple loop.

nova/pci/manager.py:
In python3 keys() returns an iterator instead of a list (copy of the keys).
This was causing error "RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during
iteration".

nova/pci/stats.py:
Python3 doesn't support cmp anymore.  Use '==' operator instead.

nova/tests/unit/pci/test_manager.py:
keys() now returns dict_keys.  Convert it to a list so that we can compare it
with [].

nova/tests/unit/pci/test_stats.py:
Map are lazily evaluated, convert to basic loop.

Partially Implements: blueprint nova-python3-newton

commit_message:
Write script to /var/tmp instead of /usr/local/bin

/var/tmp is world writeable which allows this local
task to be run by non-root users

Further, the deployment host never executes the script
so there is no need for it to be in a location which is
in the $PATH

Icf47ca346634885cab521fc054493ce623f17cb9

Change-Id: I84616d25a0e3231efd32da01f72607fe45c1b434

commit_message:
Change stack.id from UUID to Integer

The following changes have been made:

- stack.id altered to integer. Tables with foreign
  key constraint on stack.id also altered to integer.
- stack.owner_id used in nested stacks altered to int
- Identifiers operate on stack.uuid and no change in
  their behavior.
- Altered tests to use uuid/id appropriately
- New db_api call to get stack_get_by_uuid for
  stack identifier lookup.
- pagination to use stack.uuid as marker.
- Versioned objects now use IntegerField for stack_id ref.

Co-authored-by: Visnusaran Murugan <visnusaran.murugan@hp.com>

Closes-Bug: #1263787
Change-Id: I3633de70de4c35161c417ba7780222b125ee8721

Currently the FnGetRefid always return the ipaddress for EIP, even
if the resoruce is not created yet. This cause issue to the
ElasticIpAssociation.validate() because it assume the bool(eip)

Closes-Bug: 1399475

commit_message:
Return valid refid for eip if not created yet

Currently the FnGetRefid always return the ipaddress for EIP, even
if the resoruce is not created yet. This cause issue to the
ElasticIpAssociation.validate() because it assume the bool(eip)
is True.

We should return the name if the EIP is not created yet.

Change-Id: If29bdd45ef6151d6e0097f11912e9810be4724bb
Closes-Bug: 1399475

Bug report shows a common error to have LaunchConfigrationName refer to
an AWS::EC2::Instance resource.  This patch adds a validation when
checking the property contents.  This checking might be a little bit too
strong, though I cannot imagine a scenario where 'LaunchConfiguration'

commit_message:
Add type validation for LaunchConfigurationName

Bug report shows a common error to have LaunchConfigrationName refer to
an AWS::EC2::Instance resource.  This patch adds a validation when
checking the property contents.  This checking might be a little bit too
strong, though I cannot imagine a scenario where 'LaunchConfiguration'
resource type is used for other purposes.

Change-Id: I3b1ced9628c8b8b64ef03321f88cd5822d036621
Closes-Bug: 1386087

subject: Add optional health maintenance to OS::Heat::ASG
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-17 07:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/engine/stack_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resources/stack.py', 'heat/common/config.py', 'heat/scaling/template.py'], 'message': "Add optional health maintenance to OS::Heat::ASG

Adds to OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup the option to maintain health of a
member as determined by Neutron's LBaaS for the
OS::Neutron::PoolMember that is, when this functionality is engaged,
required to be a part of the member.

Currently it is possible to write a Heat template that prescribes a
set of virtual resources with health maintenance, using the health
determinations made by Neutron's LBaaS.  While it is possible, it is
ugly.  The user is required to write a bunch of mechanism for each
thing that the user wants maintained.  There is no way for a user or a
cloud operator to write a template resource (formerly known as a
provider template) that implements this abstraction.  In contrast,
some other IaaS platforms have health maintenance as a built-in part
of the functionality of their scaling groups.  The proposed change is
to generalize ``OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup`` so that it can optionally
maintain member health as determined by LBaaS.  Note that LBaaS has
health checking functionality that does not require any actual
application traffic to be load balanced.  The goal here is not to
attempt fully general health maintenance, only to cover common cases
--- with an interface that we think is reasonable to use and does not
paint ourselves into a corner regarding future implementations.  It
just so happens that all of the users I know to be wanting health
maintenance will be satisfied with this generalization of
``OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup`` --- and be happy to use it instead of
repeating a bunch of mechanism using ``OS::Heat::HARestarter`` and/or
other stuff --- supposing the relevant schedulers do not keep putting
guests on broken hosts (which is really a separate problem).

Change-Id: I05164d5de3d6925e8effd1aa9157a61cd64b8e24
Implements: blueprint autoscaling-healthy-group
"}]
commit_message:
Add optional health maintenance to OS::Heat::ASG

Adds to OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup the option to maintain health of a
member as determined by Neutron's LBaaS for the
OS::Neutron::PoolMember that is, when this functionality is engaged,
required to be a part of the member.

Currently it is possible to write a Heat template that prescribes a
set of virtual resources with health maintenance, using the health
determinations made by Neutron's LBaaS.  While it is possible, it is
ugly.  The user is required to write a bunch of mechanism for each
thing that the user wants maintained.  There is no way for a user or a
cloud operator to write a template resource (formerly known as a
provider template) that implements this abstraction.  In contrast,
some other IaaS platforms have health maintenance as a built-in part
of the functionality of their scaling groups.  The proposed change is
to generalize ``OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup`` so that it can optionally
maintain member health as determined by LBaaS.  Note that LBaaS has
health checking functionality that does not require any actual
application traffic to be load balanced.  The goal here is not to
attempt fully general health maintenance, only to cover common cases
--- with an interface that we think is reasonable to use and does not
paint ourselves into a corner regarding future implementations.  It
just so happens that all of the users I know to be wanting health
maintenance will be satisfied with this generalization of
``OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup`` --- and be happy to use it instead of
repeating a bunch of mechanism using ``OS::Heat::HARestarter`` and/or
other stuff --- supposing the relevant schedulers do not keep putting
guests on broken hosts (which is really a separate problem).

Change-Id: I05164d5de3d6925e8effd1aa9157a61cd64b8e24
Implements: blueprint autoscaling-healthy-group

commit_message:
Validation to avoid duplicate stack names per tenant

Multiple simultaneous stack create requests result in
duplicate stack names per tenant. Added validation in
db api to avoid it.

Change-Id: I338692d12b380bc757b34839d947f474a3581aee

commit_message:
Modify the default cpu-mode for aarh64 in Libvirt

For AArch64, KVM don't recognize the cpu-mode "none",
so change the default cpu-mode as host-passthrough for
generating nova.conf

Change-Id: I94a22e5a15a974b9c11e9f9fd996857453b6e2ca
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-22 16:28:41.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/copy.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_copy.py'], 'message': "Copy headers correctly when copying object

Fix copy middleware so that all client-defined object
headers that object servers allow to be persisted are copied.
For example, content-encoding and content-disposition will
now be copied.

Fix treatment of x-fresh-metadata header so that, when it is
used, new object sysmeta is applied to the object copy in the
same way as a copy without x-fresh-metadata.

Remove unnecessary passing of original request headers to
sink PUT request constructor: passing the environ is sufficient
to have the new request inherit the original's headers.

Add tests for this change and to verify that content-type
gets either copied or updated if supplied with the copy
request.

Add tests for x-fresh-metadata treatment.

Closes-Bug: #1391826
Closes-Bug: #1600247
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I917fb0b4e831c13e04ade1c5e0b9821802dec967
"}]
commit_message:
Copy headers correctly when copying object

Fix copy middleware so that all client-defined object
headers that object servers allow to be persisted are copied.
For example, content-encoding and content-disposition will
now be copied.

Fix treatment of x-fresh-metadata header so that, when it is
used, new object sysmeta is applied to the object copy in the
same way as a copy without x-fresh-metadata.

Remove unnecessary passing of original request headers to
sink PUT request constructor: passing the environ is sufficient
to have the new request inherit the original's headers.

Add tests for this change and to verify that content-type
gets either copied or updated if supplied with the copy
request.

Add tests for x-fresh-metadata treatment.

Closes-Bug: #1391826
Closes-Bug: #1600247
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I917fb0b4e831c13e04ade1c5e0b9821802dec967

commit_message:
Allow dnsmasq to inject metadata route with next_hop set to VM's IP

Normally the metadata route provided for a VM has the next_hop
set to either the DHCP port IP or the gateway IP depending on
if a router is attached to the associated subnet. This change
allows the next_hop to be set as VM's IP.

This patch is for internal native metadata testing only.
It will not be merged.

Change-Id: I3a9a40ddfcadb5328f07c4288f3338626389c4a2

Pecan: Fix Shim code

ShimRequest needed to expose the original attributes of the
request so the get params can be looked up by the API layer
to generate filters. It also needed to set the correct status
codes.

subject: Have explicit jobs per test node image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 18:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Have explicit jobs per test node image

This is one of the options available for us in order to split the
stable/liberty and mitaka jobs onto Trusty and Newton/master onto
Xenial.

This setup is extremely explicit so it should be hard to accidentally
run jobs on the wrong image. The big drawback to this setup is we just
doubled the total number of jobs we have to load into our job runners.

An alternative to this method is to do what we did for the Precise and
Trusty split. During that split we had a parameter function pick the
instance type based on the branch. Unfortunately this hid the selection
logic of which instance type to use in a function that few knew existed.
This led to confusion when jobs ran on the wrong instance or showed up
as NOT_REGISTERED because zuul and the job runner didn't agree on where
the job should run.

Change-Id: I0b5efcf6c3f4ebeca5496ce22ac90dfec3291efe
"}]
commit_message:
Have explicit jobs per test node image

This is one of the options available for us in order to split the
stable/liberty and mitaka jobs onto Trusty and Newton/master onto
Xenial.

This setup is extremely explicit so it should be hard to accidentally
run jobs on the wrong image. The big drawback to this setup is we just
doubled the total number of jobs we have to load into our job runners.

An alternative to this method is to do what we did for the Precise and
Trusty split. During that split we had a parameter function pick the
instance type based on the branch. Unfortunately this hid the selection
logic of which instance type to use in a function that few knew existed.
This led to confusion when jobs ran on the wrong instance or showed up
as NOT_REGISTERED because zuul and the job runner didn't agree on where
the job should run.

Change-Id: I0b5efcf6c3f4ebeca5496ce22ac90dfec3291efe

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools
is assertEqual(expected, observed).

Closes bug: #1259292

Change-Id: Ic16cbbe2854311dcad755402363e2f72deea186e

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown,
it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I5c24d4666458a78e752d3a7957a5d895947c7fe6

commit_message:
Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy

Its absence results in swift using up all the memory available to it when
certain objects are requested, we are not sure exactly what triggers the
problem but we know this fixes it.

Change-Id: Iaf00a8a2a947e0683cc60fef2e75fd7c444d07a8
Closes-Bug: #1595916
(cherry picked from commit 286b8e6f06e29450da483729acb61e0a470abc5c)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 03:09:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Don't log stack trace on validation exception

This change prevents the stack trace logging when a validation
exception is raised. These exceptions are triggered by template
content, so logging a stack trace is not appropriate since the target

Change-Id: I87ac6ab8c9ef7a53bbe039d66baaf04b8554f49e
Closes-Bug: #1606404
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log stack trace on validation exception

This change prevents the stack trace logging when a validation
exception is raised. These exceptions are triggered by template
content, so logging a stack trace is not appropriate since the target
for the error is the end user.

Change-Id: I87ac6ab8c9ef7a53bbe039d66baaf04b8554f49e
Closes-Bug: #1606404

subject: Don't log stack trace on resource exception
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 03:09:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Don't log stack trace on resource exception

A full heat_integrationtests run should not cause heat-engine to log
anything to ERROR (even when testing error conditions, since those
errors should be targeted at the end-user).

This change prevents the stack trace logging when a resource raises an
exception during an action, since exceptions are generally used to
deliberately put the resource into an ERROR state.

Change-Id: I415089e0eae0abdfd5ab49abce81dc0bdd3e33fe
Partial-Bug: #1606404
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log stack trace on resource exception

A full heat_integrationtests run should not cause heat-engine to log
anything to ERROR (even when testing error conditions, since those
errors should be targeted at the end-user).

This change prevents the stack trace logging when a resource raises an
exception during an action, since exceptions are generally used to
deliberately put the resource into an ERROR state.

Change-Id: I415089e0eae0abdfd5ab49abce81dc0bdd3e33fe

commit_message:
Explicitly set heat.conf logging_exception_prefix

Gate logs for heat jobs really need to log stack traces with TRACE
instead of ERROR because some traces are being printed by passing
exc_info=True to LOG.info so they are not actual errors.

This part of an effort to make normal heat gate jobs log nothing as
ERROR.

Change-Id: I495a81a94844b289173df659c09b05685df5b6c9
Partial-Bug: #1606404

commit_message:
lib/neutron-legacy: replace ip when re-stacking

Replicated Yi Zhao's fix for re-adding ipv6 addresses to neutron-legacy
(review I9ff62023dbc29a88aec3c48af331c0a49a1270bb).
Previously, re-stacking failed with "File exists" for ipv6 addresses
on br-ex.  With this change, the existing address is replaced on
br-ex with the appropriate address.

Change-Id: I6e6235132a34469f4e68b5bb3cf51ebdf01c83a2

commit_message:
Fixing crond crashing with centos/source

This PS address the issue encountered with the latest master, crond
container's docker file did not have any logic for source type of
installation as a result no binaries were install causing container's
constant restart. Fixing logic in cron's docker file.

Change-Id: I318aa9cb16517e21e0fe58393ee577701331b077
Closes-Bug: #1607336

This improves the debug output by:

1. Putting all failed deployment output in a single log file
2. Pretty printing the puppet standard error using jq

For 2, it can be pretty hard to read the puppet output in the

commit_message:
Improve debug output for failed overcloud deployments

This improves the debug output by:

1. Putting all failed deployment output in a single log file
2. Pretty printing the puppet standard error using jq

For 2, it can be pretty hard to read the puppet output in the
heat deployment-show output, so by pulling it out using jq it is
much more easy to see what the actual error is.

Change-Id: Idd03cbee574e0538a1c4d7f8ea454656a9ad83f2
