revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-28 13:34:13.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Implement basic undercloud sanity checks

Add a new feature (disabled by default) to whether or not check
undercloud sanity by testing OpenStack APIs.

* Create undercloud_sanity_check function, that is a basic sanity check
checking if OpenStack APIs are correctly running. Note: use set -x for
openstack cli commands, so we can see what is running.

* Add UNDERCLOUD_SANITY_CHECK parameter (disabled by default) to whether
  or not activate undercloud sanity checks.

Change-Id: I1ff2cc9c1287416405e20fb09e8662acf20507e2
'}]
commit_message:
Implement basic undercloud sanity checks

Add a new feature (disabled by default) to whether or not check
undercloud sanity by testing OpenStack APIs.

* Create undercloud_sanity_check function, that is a basic sanity check
checking if OpenStack APIs are correctly running. Note: use set -x for
openstack cli commands, so we can see what is running.

* Add UNDERCLOUD_SANITY_CHECK parameter (disabled by default) to whether
  or not activate undercloud sanity checks.

Change-Id: I1ff2cc9c1287416405e20fb09e8662acf20507e2

revisions:

[mitaka-only] On master I3918f24c0c87cb626a28645b46e3df6360d5f924
makes it so nova uses the oslo middleware for the header parsing.

That isn't available in mitaka, so we can set the
secure_proxy_ssl_header explicitly via hieradata. Note this is

I22deb886706fe71115a04fb52a7051be4783a5c4

Change-Id: I9a5284869d3fca9615d7cbb84705a9cddd0df44a
"}]
commit_message:
Set secure_proxy_ssl_header 'HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO' for nova-api

[mitaka-only] On master I3918f24c0c87cb626a28645b46e3df6360d5f924
makes it so nova uses the oslo middleware for the header parsing.

That isn't available in mitaka, so we can set the
secure_proxy_ssl_header explicitly via hieradata. Note this is
added to mitaka puppet-nova as an option in change:
I22deb886706fe71115a04fb52a7051be4783a5c4

Closes-Bug: 1606863

Change-Id: I9a5284869d3fca9615d7cbb84705a9cddd0df44a

commit_message:
Add support for node.resource_class

This adds support for the node.resource_class field, introduced in
API 1.21. It can be modified on an existing node or passed when
creating a node, or used as a filter when fetching a list of nodes.

commit_message:
Allow wildcard in index --type argument

Allow a wildcard character * at the end of the --type argument
to searchlight-manage index sync --type arguments. For instance,
OS::Cinder::* will match all resources with doc types starting
OS::Cinder::. The substitution is done very early early in the process
so as to largely leave the code alone.

Patch also adds functional tests for the manage command (both with
and without this functionality).

Change-Id: Ia7f1efc0a08f085ce081a800c385246c81663bc4
Implements: blueprint allow-reindexing-entire-service

commit_message:
Changing zookeeper path while updating conf

Zookeeper path is hardcoded but we recently changed the path to avoid
having to update the path every time zookeeper changed versions. We
forgot to update this path in one place which causes the cluster to fail
to scale. The patch fix that

Change-Id: Idde36e39ac4c2e2e006b4a92d92e77440666c314
Closes-bug: #1607386

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/index.rst', 'api-ref/source/os-certificates.inc', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate_os_cert-f0aa07bab1a229aa.yaml', 'nova/cmd/cert.py'], 'message': "Deprecate os-certificates

Coming out of the Nova midcycle we decided we really needed to
deprecate the os-certificates API and service. It is not used by any
of the rest of Nova. It's an API that requires a dedicated daemon to
be run. It's making Nova assume the responsibility for generating
secure certificates, even though it's not really managing entropy in
any sane way (which is why nova-cert is a service, so you could stick
these on all your computes so as to not run out of entropy).

Change-Id: I0ffa9200d8b4f52da4751e731aecffe09fd3d4be
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate os-certificates

Coming out of the Nova midcycle we decided we really needed to
deprecate the os-certificates API and service. It is not used by any
of the rest of Nova. It's an API that requires a dedicated daemon to
be run. It's making Nova assume the responsibility for generating
secure certificates, even though it's not really managing entropy in
any sane way (which is why nova-cert is a service, so you could stick
these on all your computes so as to not run out of entropy).

Change-Id: I0ffa9200d8b4f52da4751e731aecffe09fd3d4be

subject: Ability to instantiate object graph
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-28 14:13:25.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/type_scheme.py', 'murano/dsl/meta.py', 'murano/cmd/test_runner.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_type.py', 'murano/dsl/yaql_functions.py', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_contracts.py', 'releasenotes/notes/model-load-c1eb24843d30e414.yaml', 'murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/CreatingClass.yaml', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_construction.py', 'murano/dsl/object_store.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/foundation/object_model.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_results_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Ability to instantiate object graph

Adds ability to load object sub-graph in a single call.
The graph may either be defined in the serializable
object-model format

?:
  id: ...
  type: ...
  classVersion: ...
  package: ...
 prop1: value
 prop2: value2

 or in the MuranoPL format

 ns:Type:
   prop1: value1
   prop2: value2
 id: ...
 name: ...

During the load IDs of the loaded objects are re-generated so
that explicit specification of IDs is only necessary for specification
of references within the graph and are not retained.

The load is done in the temporary ObjectStore. Loaded objects are
copied to the main ObjectStore then.

3rd overload of the new() function was added to deserialize the model:
new($model, $owner)

Change-Id: I849a5d6c9a28843398a4c4c884a1c3138ac7ede3
'}]
commit_message:
Ability to instantiate object graph

Adds ability to load object sub-graph in a single call.
The graph may either be defined in the serializable
object-model format

?:
  id: ...
  type: ...
  classVersion: ...
  package: ...
 prop1: value
 prop2: value2

 or in the MuranoPL format

 ns:Type:
   prop1: value1
   prop2: value2
 id: ...
 name: ...

During the load IDs of the loaded objects are re-generated so
that explicit specification of IDs is only necessary for specification
of references within the graph and are not retained.

The load is done in the temporary ObjectStore. Loaded objects are
copied to the main ObjectStore then.

3rd overload of the new() function was added to deserialize the model:
new($model, $owner)

Change-Id: I849a5d6c9a28843398a4c4c884a1c3138ac7ede3

commit_message:
Updated ubuntu-db2 to use datastore-package element to copy files

This element
1. provides a common place to copy packages into the image
   for installing them during image building. So now every
   image element doesn't need to provide extra-data and
   install scripts to do the same work
2. provides user ability to specify the location of the package
   as file/directory/url

Change-Id: Ie15079f5eb0b9bed3f343c78357772f7a2d21ea8

commit_message:
Update the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE url to include the new branch

The danger here is that if the branch doesn't exisit and the review
merges the new branch or $project will be unconstrained and therefore
testing is somewhat voided.

We need to manage that externally to this process

Change-Id: Iae6aefefcd6b7e96d15bd5d373ae439e4fe80daf

The method get_updated_guest_xml has a specific test to ensure all
dependent methods are well called with the well parameters.  This
commit adds an assertion to ensure update_perf_events_xml is well

commit_message:
libvirt: fix missed test in migration

The method get_updated_guest_xml has a specific test to ensure all
dependent methods are well called with the well parameters.  This
commit adds an assertion to ensure update_perf_events_xml is well
called when we want to retrieve the domain xml of a guest for
migration.

Change-Id: Ifda45b824fbc819173498be606622e8e663b2626

commit_message:
Change DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION for vertica

Vertica Management console requires additional
debian packages to be installed as well as other
files for the management console to run

DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION is a directory that has
all files that need to be installed on the image

Additional changes are made to some global variables
to make sure the environment can run the
management console.

Co-Authored-By: Saurabh Surana <saurabh.surana@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sharika Pongubala <sharika.pongubala@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Craig Vyvial <cp16net@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1452926

Change-Id: I2863a21d186d9c809fa2fdb0050e4728e100b010

commit_message:
WIP/Proposal: Simplify storage deletion on destroy

By greatly simplifying the storage disconnection/deletion pieces of the
destroy flow, we cut out a bunch of LOC, and resolve the issues
described by bug 1604980.

Change-Id: Iaf948ccd349052e4301fa8ba1f75c6b9751bc2d2
Closes-Bug: 1604980

subject: Don't log exception objects
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8119, 'name': 'Eric Brown', 'email': 'eric_wade_brown@yahoo.com', 'username': 'ericwb'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 21:22:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Don't log exception objects

It's possible to run into issues when logging exception objects. The oslo_i18n
module will attempt to deepcopy parameters before loggin them. If the parameter
is an object, it will deepcopy it. This change makes it so that we pass the
exception's message instead of the whole exception object.

Change-Id: Ic8063e89f658dc34ef3b298ab5fc41ec817b9bbc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log exception objects

It's possible to run into issues when logging exception objects. The oslo_i18n
module will attempt to deepcopy parameters before loggin them. If the parameter
is an object, it will deepcopy it. This change makes it so that we pass the
exception's message instead of the whole exception object.

Change-Id: Ic8063e89f658dc34ef3b298ab5fc41ec817b9bbc

commit_message:
Using Cinder snapshot as trove backups API Change

In order to move on with the implementation of Cinder snapshots as Trove
backups we need to define the internal API changes that will take place.
This patch addresses these changes adding the necessary entry points on
the guest agent API and adding some needed configuration options.
Once we agree with the API structure we can move on with the actual code
patches.

Change-Id: I6d9f2bbe9dc6d401b4decda6c11fb09131d6cc33
Partially-implements: bp snapshot-as-backup-strategy

commit_message:
compute: Skip driver detach calls for non local instances

Only call for a driver detach from a volume if the instance is currently
associated with the local compute host. This avoids potential virt
driver and volume backend issues when attempting to disconnect from
volumes that have never been connected to from the current host.

Closes-Bug: #1583284
Change-Id: I36b8532554d75b24130f456a35acd0be838b62d6

subject: Followup on an angular Images panel switch
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-27 15:01:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/tests/test_images.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/pages/project/compute/imagespage.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/decorators.py'], 'message': 'Followup on an angular Images panel switch

There is a lot of work to be done to make new resource-panel pages to
be testable by Selenium. Few highlights that I stumbled upon while
trying to implement a more meaningful test (click a specific image in
an angularized table, go to its description page, check that image
header text is equal to the image name in table):

* Table actions/buttons are not annotated with ids or attributes in a
  machine-friendly way
* Table columns are not annotated as well for automatic extraction by
  Selenium
* Seamless dispatch between legacy and NG versions of the same page is
  absent (due to obfuscate Navigation machinery, see inline FIXME).

Change-Id: I52fb4f42d557dd7729a0b420b1d03e7353179899
'}]
commit_message:
Followup on an angular Images panel switch

There is a lot of work to be done to make new resource-panel pages to
be testable by Selenium. Few highlights that I stumbled upon while
trying to implement a more meaningful test (click a specific image in
an angularized table, go to its description page, check that image
header text is equal to the image name in table):

* Table actions/buttons are not annotated with ids or attributes in a
  machine-friendly way
* Table columns are not annotated as well for automatic extraction by
  Selenium
* Seamless dispatch between legacy and NG versions of the same page is
  absent (due to obfuscate Navigation machinery, see inline FIXME).

Change-Id: I52fb4f42d557dd7729a0b420b1d03e7353179899

subject: Write script to /var/tmp instead of /usr/local/bin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 14:39:14.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/openstack_update_hosts_file.yml'], 'message': 'Write script to /var/tmp instead of /usr/local/bin

/var/tmp is world writeable which allows this local
task to be run by non-root users

Further, the deployment host never executes the script
so there is no need for it to be in a location which is
in the $PATH

Change-Id: Icf47ca346634885cab521fc054493ce623f17cb9
'}]
commit_message:
Write script to /var/tmp instead of /usr/local/bin

/var/tmp is world writeable which allows this local
task to be run by non-root users

Further, the deployment host never executes the script
so there is no need for it to be in a location which is
in the $PATH

Change-Id: Icf47ca346634885cab521fc054493ce623f17cb9

commit_message:
Support name option for volume restore

Volume restore API supports name option to specify volume name
for new volume creation, but CLI doesn't support this option.
This change simply add name option for backup-restore command.

Change-Id: I22ccc303c86b958cb21862f718ef89f57234a027
Partial-Bug: #1539667

commit_message:
Use protocol definitions from neutron-lib

This removes the deprecation warnings for example:

  "DeprecationWarning: PROTO_NAME_TCP in version 'mitaka' and
   will be removed in version 'newton': moved to neutron_lib.constants"

Closes-Bug: #1589107
Change-Id: Ifc800e60ebff083c8e2c82ddf98ac0965b66004e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 15:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo/overcloud/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/tripleo/overcloud/templates/run-tempest.sh.j2'], 'message': "Make the number of tempest workers configurable

We recently added more vCPUs to the undercloud to workaround the
slower chassis' in CI having slower but more CPU cores. Unfortunately,
this had the side effect of making tempest use many more workers to
run tests, and our very resource constrained cloud falls over when
there are that many requests coming in concurrently.

This patch makes the number of tempest workers explicit and configurable,
rather than the default tempest behavior of using all available CPUs.

Change-Id: I8bb9ad7db0276c3bc1415707b72b93023b6365e0
"}]
commit_message:
Make the number of tempest workers configurable

We recently added more vCPUs to the undercloud to workaround the
slower chassis' in CI having slower but more CPU cores. Unfortunately,
this had the side effect of making tempest use many more workers to
run tests, and our very resource constrained cloud falls over when
there are that many requests coming in concurrently.

This patch makes the number of tempest workers explicit and configurable,
rather than the default tempest behavior of using all available CPUs.

Change-Id: I8bb9ad7db0276c3bc1415707b72b93023b6365e0

commit_message:
List all masters when creating a pool

Slaves querying designate via the vip does not work. Explicitly listing
the slaves spreads load accross the designate units and fixes the
transfers

Change-Id: I3d2814a71116c25a555a089d724a0156383e22d3
